name.text: Determining the Length of a Divider Arm from Vertical Height

questiontext.text:
The angle formed by the arms of an upright pair of dividers and the horizontal is \({@theta@}^\circ\). The vertical distance from the horizontal to the vertex is \({@d@}\,\text{cm}\). Find the length of one arm of the divider without using a calculator or trigonometric tables.

\(\text{The Length of a divider arm from vertical height}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution:

We are asked to find the length of one arm of the divider given:

  • Angle with horizontal: {@theta@}Â°
  • Vertical distance from horizontal to vertex: \({@d@}\, \text{cm}\)

From trigonometry, for an upright divider forming an angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal, the relationship between the vertical height and the arm length is:

\(\begin{align} \text{Arm length} &= \frac{\text{Vertical distance}}{\sin \theta} \\ &= \frac{@d@}{\sin({@theta@}^\circ)} \\ &= {@arm_length@} \text{ cm} \end{align}\)

Hence, the length of one arm of the divider is {@arm_length@} cm.
